pitt.search.semanticvectors.vectors

Class ComplexVector

  • java.lang.Object
    • pitt.search.semanticvectors.vectors.ComplexVector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Vector

    public class ComplexVector
extends Object
implements Vector
    Complex number implementation of Vector. Vectors come in three representations, sparse polar, dense polar, and Cartesian. Superposition and similarity measurement are different for Cartesian and dense polar vectors. The preferred operators and measures is currently chosen by setting the DOMINANT_MODE at compile time.
    Author:
    Lance De Vine, Dominic Widdows

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ComplexVector.Mode
      We use the 'MODE' enumeration to keep track of which mode the complex vector is in.

      • getVectorType

        public VectorType getVectorType()
        Returns VectorType.COMPLEX
        Specified by:
        getVectorType in interface Vector

      • setDominantMode

        protected static void setDominantMode(ComplexVector.Mode mode)
        Sets the dominant mode. VectorType.COMPLEX uses ComplexVector.Mode.POLAR_DENSE and VectorType.COMPLEXFLAT uses ComplexVector.Mode.CARTESIAN.

      • generateRandomVector

        public ComplexVector generateRandomVector(int dimension,
                                          int numEntries,
                                          Random random)
        Generates a basic sparse vector in Polar form with the format { offset, phaseAngle, offset, phaseAngle, ... } Consequently the length of the offsets array is 2 X numEntries.
        Specified by:
        generateRandomVector in interface Vector
        Parameters:
        dimension - number of dimension of vector returned
        numEntries - number of non-zero entries, usually a combination of +/-1 entries as determined by implementation
        random - random seed for generation
        Returns:
        Sparse representation of vector in Polar form.

      • generateRandomVector

        public ComplexVector generateRandomVector(int dimension,
                                          Random random)
        Generates a basic dense vector in Polar form
        Returns:
        Dense representation of vector in Polar form.

      • measureOverlap

        public double measureOverlap(Vector other)
        Description copied from interface: Vector
        Returns a canonical overlap measure (usually between 0 and 1) between this and other.
        Specified by:
        measureOverlap in interface Vector

      • measureHermitianOverlap

        protected double measureHermitianOverlap(ComplexVector other)
        Measure overlap, again using the Hermitian / Euclidean scalar product.

      • measureCartesianAngularOverlap

        protected double measureCartesianAngularOverlap(ComplexVector other)
        Measure overlap, again using the sum of cosines of phase angle difference. Note that this is different from the Hermitian scalar product.

      • measurePolarDenseOverlap

        protected double measurePolarDenseOverlap(ComplexVector other)
        Measures overlap of two vectors using mean cosine of difference of phase angles. If either coordinate is empty (see CircleLookupTable.ZERO_INDEX) then nothing is added to the score. If both coordinates are empty, the number of counted dimensions is unchanged (this is so that sparse vectors are self-similar). Transforms this and other vector to POLAR_DENSE representations.

      • normalize

        public void normalize()
        Description copied from interface: Vector
        Transforms vector to a normalized representation. A normalized representation should satisfy the property that measureOverlap with itself is equal to 1.0, to within precision tolerances.
        Specified by:
        normalize in interface Vector

      • normalizeCartesian

        public void normalizeCartesian()
        Normalizes the cartesian form of the vector so that the vector formed by each real/imaginary pair has unit length

      • normalizeHermitian

        protected void normalizeHermitian()
        Normalizes the cartesian form of the vector so that the vector formed by each real/imaginary pair has unit length

      • superpose

        public void superpose(Vector other,
                      double weight,
                      int[] permutation)
        Description copied from interface: Vector
        Superposes other vector onto this one with given weight, usually by vector addition. Coordinates of other vector may be permuted and reweighted in the process. Permuted coordinates supports encoding of order information, as begun by Sahlgren, Holst and Kanerva 2008.
        Specified by:
        superpose in interface Vector
        Parameters:
        other - vector to be added
        weight - multiple of other vector added (TODO widdows support complex weights)
        permutation - represents the permutation to be applied while adding, so that the ith coordinate of other is added to the coordinate given by the ith entry in this list. Can be NULL in which case no permutation is applied.

      • convolve

        public void convolve(ComplexVector other,
                     int direction)
        Convolves this vector with the other. If the value of direction <= 0 then the correlation operation is performed, ie. convolution inverse

      • convolveCartesian

                              int direction)
        Convolves this vector with the other. If the value of direction <= 0 then the correlation operation is performed, ie. convolution inverse

      • complement

        public void complement()
        Transforms this vector into its complement. Assumes vector is in dense polar form.
